`A child saw pig (as being) big.': ‘I find difficult to make (these) small jugs (lit. I see the small jugs that I make difficult).’
`I thought it was a giraffe.' / `I said ‘giraffe’.'
`Then Dik-dik’s children thought it was their mother, and...’

`A child saw pig (as being) big.': ‘The story of our speech... Bah! Children really don’t find our language nice (anymore).’
I find any sort of wild thing tasty.
`She struck me as beautiful/  I found her attractive / I consider her attractive'
`She struck me as good looking/pretty.'  (The evaluation came naturally.)
`I realized that she was indeed good looking/pretty.'
`I perceive/feel the ugliness of the woman.’ (Subject does not have prior knowledge of ugliness of the woman.)
‘I am consciously aware of the ugliness of the woman.’ Lit., ‘I really feel that the woman is ugly.’ (Subject is biased against the woman and exerts an effort to emphasize her ugly
Do you find Western women beautiful?’
